content.description: Central Perk, Joey is giving Rachel, Chandler, Phoebe, and Ross their bills.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay Rach, that muffin and espresso, $4.50. Ross, double latte, $2.75. Chandler, coffee and a scone, $4.25. And Pheebs, herbal tea, $1.25. So, all together that’s (pauses to figure the total) $12.75.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This coming from the man who couldn’t split our 80 dollar phone bill in half.
(A good-looking woman approaches.)

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: How much do I owe you for the muffin and the latte?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh that’s on the house courtesy of Joey Tribbiani.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Oh great! Well, tell him thanks. And since uh, Joey seems like such a nice guy, maybe we could go on a date sometime?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, he’s not used to women being so forward with him; but uh, I good check with him—He says it’s okay. (She hands him her card.) Great! Thanks! Bye-bye!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Joey, how come our stuff isn’t free?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It will be when you look like that in a tight skirt! This is great! I’m getting more dates than ever!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait a minute, you’re only giving free stuff away to the pretty girls?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah Joey that is so gross!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How about a scone on the house baby?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m pretty.

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Chandler’s, everyone but Monica is there playing Monopoly.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey does anyone have any gum?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh I do! (She grabs her huge purse and starts rummaging through it and taking out various items in a futile search for the gum.) Oh, y’know what? No. (Pause) Wait a second. (She removes a bag filled with water that has a goldfish swimming in it.) I know it’s in here somewhere.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? I’m good! I’m good!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, what are you doing here? Shouldn’t you be at work?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ugh, they sent me home. They said I can’t work if I’m sick.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m so sorry you’re sick.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m not sick!! I don’t get sick! Getting sick is for weaklings and for pansies!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, no one thinks you’re a pansy, but we do think you need a tissue. (She notices something hanging from Monica’s nose, as does Joey.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I have not been sick in over three years! (Sneezes.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m gonna grab you some tissue.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t need a tissue! I’m fine-d!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: When you put a ‘D’ at the end of ‘Fine’ you’re not fine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m fine-d. I’m fine-d! Y’know, it’s a really hard word to say.
(There’s a knock on the door. The gang is stunned and Phoebe counts to make sure that everyone is there. Out of curiosity Chandler goes and answers the door.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes?
(A woman enters.)

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi, is Rachel here? I’m her sister.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, Jill!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Oh my God, Rachel!
(They run and hug each other.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God, introduce us!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This is Chandler. (Points at him.)

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And you know Monica and Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi Jill.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And that’s Phoebe (points), and that’s Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, (in the Joey voice) how you doin’?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Don’t!! (Joey backs away frightened.) (To Jill) Honey, what are you doing here?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Which-which sister is this? Is this the spoiled one or that’s bitter?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Daddy cut me off.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Never mind, I got it.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: And y’know what I said to him? “I’m gonna hire a lawyer and I’m gonna sue you and take all your money. Then I’m gonna cut you off!”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! What did he say?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: That he wouldn’t pay for my lawyer! Then he told me to come here and learn about the value of money from the one daughter he’s actually proud off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Did you hear that?! My dad’s proud of me! My dad’s proud of me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach? (Points to Jill.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, sorry. Wait honey, so what did you do that made dad cut you off?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Okay, I bought a boat.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You bought a boat?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Yeah but it wasn’t for me, it was for a friend.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Boy did we make friends with the wrong sister! (Rachel glares at him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Jill, honey, I think this is the best thing that could’ve ever happened to you. I mean you needed to get out on your own anyway! And you know when I did it, I-I-I at first I was scared, and look at me now! I’m the only daughter dad is proud of! Okay, well this is, this is what you’re gonna do. You’re gonna get a job, you’re gonna get an apartment, and then I’ll help you and you can stay with us. Right Pheebs, she can stay with us?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Of course, yeah!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Oh, that’s so great! Okay, I’m really gonna do this! I don’t know how to thank you guys.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, I like cards.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is working as Phoebe and Ross are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you all finished here?

content.speaker: Customer
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great! (Joey takes his cookie and finishes it.)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Okay, here are the tips for this morning. Jen gets 50, 50 for me, and Joey owes eight dollars.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: For all the free food you gave away.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well if it’s free food, how come you’re charging me for it?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: We don’t give anything away unless it’s someone’s birthday.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, what if they came in third in a modeling contest?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sorry! (He grabs her muffin away and returns it to the serving tray.)
content.parenthetical: to a woman who came in third in a modeling contest

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: I just had the hardest day. Those bags are so heavy. (Sets them down.)
content.parenthetical: entering, carrying a bunch of shopping bags

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Jill, how did you pay for all this? I thought your dad took away your credit card.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Oh please, I memorized those numbers when I was 15. But look at all the cool make-it-on-my-own stuff I got! (Holds up a red sweater) This is my “Please, hire me” sweater. (Holds up a pair of black pants) And these are my, “Don’t you want to rent me this apartment?” pants.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t think charging new clothes too your dad qualifies as making it on your own.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Oh, Mr. Scientist has to get all technical!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Seriously, I don’t Rachel’s gonna think it’s a good idea.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: So who made her queen of the world?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I would love that job!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! What’s goin’ on?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Jill! Did you shop?!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: No! They did! (Points to Phoebe and Ross)

content.speaker: Phoebe and Ross
content.text: Yeah, we went shopping!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You went shopping?! What, and then you just came in here and paraded it right under Jill’s nose when you know she’s trying to quit. Wow, you guys are terrible!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sorry Jill.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry-sorry Jill.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’d you get?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh well, all right, I got (Ross hands her a bag) (To Ross) thank you, I got uh, this y’know “I want a job sweater.” (Holds up the same sweater.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And, and then I got uh, these are apartment pants.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Apartment pants?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, you never heard of them?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, of course, of course I’ve heard of them! Ross, what did you get?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh? Oh, I got this—(Holds up this pink frilly thing)—this!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: A pajmena?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! Oh, I-I love this babies!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ross, wants a pajmena?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s a rug. (Jill winces.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Jill?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: I’m sorry Rachel, I’m sorry…
content.parenthetical: covers her eyes and starts crying

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on! You think that’s gonna work on me?! I invented that!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Right! But, I am sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, it’s okay. One little setback is okay, just don’t let it happen again, all right? Now since daddy paid for all this stuff, I should take it all away. But I’m just gonna take the-the pajmena. (Ross hands it to her.) And the uh, and the uh pants. Y’know what, I’m just gonna take it all away, ‘cause that way you’ll just really learn the lesson. Okay? All righty, I’m gonna run a couple of errands and I will see you at dinner. (Leaves with all of Jill’s stuff.)

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: She took all my stuff.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Everything but, the little blue one. (Holds it up for her.)

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: That’s the best one! Oh my God, (hugs him) thank you so much!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well. Hey…

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Oh my gosh, that was so lame. Like a pajmena could be a rug!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah, how about you and the, (mimics her fake cry) “I’m sorry!”

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Shut up! I did not sound like that at all!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What about, what about when I said y’know about the apartment pants, how dumb was I?
(They both look at her.)

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Were you this cute in high school?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh stop.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: No you stop!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, you stop!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: You stop!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay-okay, why don’t I sit here and you’ll both stop it!
content.parenthetical: gets up and sits between them

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is still very sick and is entering the living room from the bathroom wearing a robe. Chandler is reading a magazine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, so what do you, what do you want to do? Let’s do something crazy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know, let’s rest and drink lots of fluids. (Holds up a glass of orange juice.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’ll rest. But y’know if I’m going to bed, then you’re coming with me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That would be impossible to resist if you weren’t all drippy here. (Points to his nose.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you saying that you don’t wanna get with this? (Tries to do a little sexy body rub, but it doesn’t work all that well with the big robe.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I don’t you should say that even when you’re healthy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on. (Coughs loudly.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t take this personally okay? It’s just that I just can’t have sex with a sick person.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m with you Chandler! I mean I can’t have sex with a sick person either, that’s disgusting! But I’m not sick! Let me prove it to you. We are two healthy people in the pribe of libe.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s the thing, see I would like to stay in the pribe of mwha-ah-libe.

content.description: Phoebe and Rachel’s, Rachel is putting away her new clothes as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s up?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, I think there’s something you should maybe know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, it’d better not be about the apartment pants, because I just pitched the idea to my boss at Ralph Lauren and she loved it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. No. It’s just I was umm, I was with Ross and Jill after you left and umm, I’m pretty sure I saw a little spark between them.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah I mean it’s probably nothing, but I just wanted to warn you that there might be something there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: With Ross and Jill?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: With Ross and my sister?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: With my sister Jill and my ex-boyfriend Ross?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh there is no way.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay then.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! I can not believe that! I mean I don’t really like it when Ross goes out with anyone, but my sister isn’t that like incest or something?! Oh my God, and they’re gonna have sex! Oh! Oh no what if he marries her too?! Oh this is just terrible, this is just terrible. And I can’t stop it! I can’t—I don’t own Ross! Y’know? And Jill, she should be able to do whatever it is that she wants to do! And oh my God, I can’t believe Ross is marrying my little sister, this terrible. Oh my God, this is just the worst thing that could have ever happened to me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But great news about the apartment pants, huh?

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is giving the bill to the same beautiful woman from before.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’ll be $3.85.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: What do you mean? Yesterday you said I was too pretty to pay for stuff!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s just I can’t because my manager said I… (Gets an idea) (Starts singing) “Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you. Happy birthday dear Annie…

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Amy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: “…Amy! Happy birthday to you!”

content.speaker: A Male Customer
content.text: Hey, that’s weird, today’s my birthday too!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, not it here it isn’t.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Sorry I’m late, what’s up?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh hi! Y’know, I just wanted to see if there were any leads on the old job front.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Oh no! But I just walked past three sales and I didn’t go in. How strong am I?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is great. Hey, y’know who doesn’t have to job hunt? Ross. He works at the university.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh so you know that, you guys talked about that, so you get along, so you think you’re gonna go out?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Me go out with Ross?! No! God no! What would make you think that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I just, Phoebe, said y’know thought she saw something between you guys.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: No! I mean he’s nice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: He’s the kind of guy you’re friends with, y’know? But he’s not the kind of guy you date. He’s the kind of guy you’d date because you did. Me, not so much.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh not-not so much. Umm, what-what do you, what do you mean is there something wrong with Ross?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Oh no-no-no, he’s just I don’t know, he’s just a little bookish.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are-are you saying he’s a geek?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: You think so too?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! No I, no Ross is not a geek!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Fine, then let’s just say he’s not my type.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What handsome is not your type? Smart? Kind? Good kisser? What those things aren’t on your list? Ross is a great guy! You would be lucky to be with him!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Well okay, if it means that much to you, then I’ll ask him out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no-no-no, no-no-no, that’s not what I meant.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: No! Y’know what Rachel? You’re right, y’know he has been really nice to me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah but, he’s not your type.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Yeah but maybe that’s a good thing. Y’know I’m doing all these different sorts of things, and maybe I should try dating a geek too!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah but, you don’t, you don’t, you don’t want to try to much too fast. Y’know? I mean, you do remember what happened to the little girl that tried to much too fast don’t you?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She-she died Jill.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler has fallen asleep reading a book. Monica calls from the bedroom and wakes him up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh what is it honey, you need some tea? Some soup? (He gets up from the couch and goes into the bedroom to find Monica, still in the robe, lying seductively on the bed. Or at least she’s trying too and as he enters the room, she takes the robe off on of her legs.) Oh-ohhhh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Calling Dr. Big, Dr. Big to the bed.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh Jeez honey, I thought, I thought you were asleep.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How could I be asleep knowing that you were in the next room.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was asleep. (She takes off her robe and starts to shiver) Oh no! No-no honey! Y’know what’s sexy? Layers. Layers are sexy. And blankets are sexy. And oh! Hot water bottles are sexy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on, get into bed! I want to prove to you that I’m not sick! I wanna make you feel, as good as I feel. (Sneezes.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Would you please get some rest!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m fine. (She goes into one of those half sneezing, half-coughing fits that you get with a bad cold or flu.)

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is singing Happy Birthday to yet another good-looking woman. Gunther is watching and is not very happy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: “Happy birthday to you!”

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: You’re paying for that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? No-no it’s her birthday!

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: You’ve sung Happy Birthday to 20 different women today!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But it really…

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: You are no longer authorized to distribute birthday muffins.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Damnit! (Storms off.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach? Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did you tell your sister to ask me out?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well yeah…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh wow! I mean, wow! I mean, I-I-I think she’s cute but I-I would never have thought of going out with her, never!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah but after you said it was okay, I figured, “Why not?!”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh so-so not really never.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I have to say you are a much bigger person than I am. I mean after all we’ve been through, I just—y’know I wish I had a brother to reciprocate. Hey, if you ever want to go out with Monica, you have my blessing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-ho, and mine!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is still sick and is hobbling out into the living room for some help from Chandler who’s on the couch reading.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, I think I’m sick.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really? Struck down in the pribe of libe!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, fine I admit it! I feel terrible! Would you please rub this on my chest? (She hands him some of that Vicks Vap-O-Rub to put on.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no-no-no-no, you are not getting me this way.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on! I really need your help!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no-no!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fine, I’ll rub it on myself.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

(To start this task, she lowers the top of her robe to reveal that she is naked from the waist up, well at least her back is, and starts to rub on the gunk. Chandler notices this, and has something start happening. I’ll let you fill in the blank here.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you’re just, kinda rubbing it on yourself?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s nice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you kidding me?! Is this; is this turning you on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! (Hangs his head in shame.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe it! What is it? Is it the rubbing or the smell?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s all very, very good. (She covers up and sits down.) So you wanna go uh, mix it up?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not now, I’m sick!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh come on you big faker!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What happened to your rule about never sleeping with sick people?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well that was before all the vaporizing action.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, if you really wanna have sex…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! (Runs into the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Worked like a charm.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is there as Jill enters to start her date with Ross.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Wh-what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: This is where Ross and I are meeting for our date. So, what do you think? (She spins to show Rachel the outfit she’s wearing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I-I don’t like it.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s kinda slutty.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: It’s yours!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah well, I’m-I’m a slut.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi Jill!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi (sees Rachel and forgets her name for a moment).

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel! Well, you-you’re not at home, you’re-you’re-you’re right here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah I know, and I bet you thought it would be weird. But it’s not!
(There’s an awkward silence.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. So well I’ll umm, (To Rachel) I’ll have her home by midnight.
(Rachel laughs a little too hard as Ross and Jill leave for their date. After they have left, Rachel starts to break down.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Rachel enters and walks quickly over to the window to watch Ross’s apartment. We see that Ross’s apartment is empty.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why aren’t you home yet?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is someone there?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yes, it’s me! Sorry!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, I’m just, I’m just looking out your window. At-at the view. What are you guys doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We got some Vap-O-Rub in some places.
(We see that Ross is returning to his apartment with Jill.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, he brought her back to his apartment.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who? (She looks out the window at Ross’s apartment) Is that your sister?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, she is a slut!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: God, Ross is on a date with your sister! How weird is that?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, look-look he’s taking off her clothes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s taking off her coat!
(We see that Ross is taking off Jill’s coat.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, this is just terrible.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no it’s not, no it’s not. It’s a first date. I’m sure that nothing is gonna…(as she is talking we see Ross close his drapes.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. (Squeaks again.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ho-oh, he’s gonna get some! (Rachel looks at him.) Of the glare from the streetlight out of his apartment. Y’know so umm, he’s closed the drapes there so he can have a nice, pleasant conversation with your little sister. (Pause) Well, I’m off to bed! (Goes to bed.)
(There is no credits scene, just a preview of the next couple of episodes.)
